learned  Presidentâ€™s  Counsel 
for  the  appellant 
formulated  his

column1: arguments on the following grounds of appeal:

column2: The learned Trial Judge has failed to adequately consider the
facts in favour of the accused-appellant as required by law.
The  obvious  infirmities  in  the  case  for  the  prosecution  have
not been considered adequately and reasons for acting upon
the evidence notwithstanding such infirmities have not been
The dying deposition of the deceased has not been considered
utilizing the tests laid down by our courts.
The defence of alibi taken up by the accused throughout the
trial has not been adequately considered.
